author: Alex Scapens
title: Steam train rescued from 'death row' to haul passengers across Greater Manchester
text:
News Steam train rescued from 'death row' to haul passengers across Greater Manchester The Lancashire Lazarus will start at Bury and pass through Stockport after enthusiasts spent £750,000 bringing it back to life Share The 76804 steam engine has been brought back to life and will run across Greater Manchester Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
A steam engine that spent 15 years on the scrapheap will haul passengers for the first time in five decades, after a £750,000 restoration. 
The Standard Four 76084 - dubbed the Lancashire Lazarus - will run from Bury , across Greater Manchester, to Buxton, via Stockport, on Saturday. 
It will complete a remarkable comeback for the engine which was built at Horwich Works in 1957. 
The train spent 10 years in service before being towed away to the scrap yard in 1967. It was rescued 15 years later by an enthusiast for £7,500. 
After several more changes of ownership it has finally been brought back to life. The 76804 steam engine, dubbed the Lancashire Lazarus, spent years on train 'death row' 
Melvin Thorley, a train enthusiast from Offerton , will be among those watching its resurrection and will ‘chase’ the train along its route. 
The 69-year-old said: “Train enthusiasts will be amazed to see it again. It is from another era and, in the nicest possible way, a dinosaur.” Read More Victoria station roof collapse WAS caused by seagulls - and hub bosses blundered by not repairing it sooner 
Mr Thorley said: “It was a wreck so it is astounding that it has been restored. It cost so much for the current owners as it was such a large project. It was just a steel shell. 
“This was the last train of its type to come out of service which meant when it came to be scrapped it slipped through the net. It was fate. 
“It was basically on ‘death row’ but steel prices had fallen and by the time they got round to scrapping it, the train had nostalgia value and was sold.” The 76804 steam engine will travel from Bury to Buxton via Stockport. 
The 100-tonne engine, which is 18m long, will leave Bury at 8.52am and cross Belmont Bridge before stopping at Stockport station from 9.21am to 9.31am. 
It will also pass through Davenport at 9.35am, Hazel Grove at 9.40am and New Mills , Marsh Lane, at 9.49am, before reaching Buxton. Read More 
Of the 115 trains of its type only four survived. They were built in the 1950s but taken out of service as diesel engines made them obsolete within a decade.
